tasks.title: Check context status
tasks.description: Evaluate context/tracker.json items and update it directly; also produce context/check_summary.md (combined summary + details needed).

tasks.title: Brainstorm idea (raw → structured)
tasks.description: Convert a raw idea into a structured spec in context/idea.md, including title, elevator pitch, features, risks, and milestones.
examples: Brainstorm this idea: 'generate workout plans from calendar'
Help me evolve an idea into an explainable spec

tasks.title: Top next to-dos
tasks.description: Produce the top 3–5 to-dos to focus on for the next commit, based on tracker.json, idea.md, to_do.md, and goal.md.
examples: What should I work on next for this idea?

tasks.title: Update to-do list
tasks.description: Append one or more new items to context/to_do.md (creates file if missing).

tasks.title: Git commit helper
tasks.description: Refine a commit message, propose branch name, and generate exact git commands to run locally (never run automatically).
examples: Commit current changes with message 'wip: add login UI'

tasks.title: Git status helper
tasks.description: Check current git status (modified, staged, untracked files) and produce a short report.
examples: Which files are modified and staged?

tasks.title: Git diff helper
tasks.description: Inspect repo changes by running git diff commands. Categorize Added/Modified/Deleted/Renamed files and save a report to artifacts/git_diff_report.md.
examples: Show git diff for last commit
What files changed in staged diff?

tasks.title: Git add helper
tasks.description: Stage files for commit by generating explicit git add commands based on user input. Always confirm before finalizing.

tasks.title: Update README.md (staged-diff first, orchestrates internal tasks)
tasks.description: Use staged diff as the source of truth. Orchestrate internal tasks (git_status, git_diff, git_add, check_context, git_commit) to gather data, present inline README edits derived from staged changes, and on explicit 'confirm' apply edits. Never run git or push automatically; always require human confirmation for writes and staging.
examples: Update README using staged changes and internal tasks

tasks.title: List available tasks
tasks.description: Display all registered tasks with their id, title, description, and example invocations.
